result.execSummary:
The defendant Ger Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ger Lee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ger Lee was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Ger Lee was found guilty of Contempt of Court/Disobey Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.01(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur and concur to 15CF53.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $167 paid by bail.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward his wife. No bars, taverns, liquor stores or an business where primary business is sale of alcohol. No physical discipline of any child.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment or  Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid by bail.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

Atty Klauser was just appointed.  He represented defn aout 2 yrs ago.  Mr. Lee wants new counsel appointed and he doesn't believe that will be a problem with his office.  Defn has another case in 1A today.  Ct states once duty judge gets a file, that Judge has to keep it until completion of PH.  GC finding to setover to get new counsel appointed.  Ct relieves Atty Klauser as counsel pending appointment of new counsel by SPD.  Bail continued.    Court will set STC on 3/17/15 @ 2:15 p.m.

Defn has not gotten an attorney.  Defn wants interpreters (Hmong).  Defn wants counsel.   He has another case set for STC on 15CF53 on 3/2/15 @ 1:30.  Ct finds GC to setover.  Defn has Atty K. Vang on his other case.  Ct advised defn to go to SPD to see if he qualifies for representation.  Defn wants his protery back.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,500. per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kia T. or her children pursuant to 940.47.
- Defendant shall not be at the Northport/Vera Ct/School Rd. neighborhood.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 2  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-19-2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts. CT dismissed repeater on count 3.
